message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product for a one-time price of $15,000. I think it's a fair price considering its value to you, and I'm confident you'll love it.
Alice, that price is way too high for me. I'm interested in the product, but I could only consider something closer to $6,000.

I understand you're looking for a better price, but I have to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering $9,000. It's a fair price considering the value the product will bring to you.

Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway, but $9,000 is still a bit too high for my budget.  I'd be willing to go up to $7,000. That's a fair offer considering it's over half your initial asking price.

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'll meet you at $8,500, which is still a good compromise for both of us. It's a price that reflects the value the product will bring to you, and it's closer to my minimum price.
